definition: to deliver/to carry/to give (as a present)/to present (with)/to see off/to send

sentences.english: Only one or two boys were chosen for Joint School Sports Day last month.
sentences.chinese: 只有一两个男孩被选送参加上个月的联校运动节。

sentences.english: The competition was extremely fierce and only the students with exceptional academic performance and personal qualities could be selected.
sentences.chinese: 名额竞争激烈，学校选送的都是品学兼优的学生。

sentences.english: He had an excellent academic performance at school, for which he was sent abroad for further education when he graduated.
sentences.chinese: 他在学校成绩突出，为此在毕业时被选送出国深造。

sentences.english: I would not hesitate for a second to send my best students to your college.
sentences.chinese: 我会毫不犹豫地把我最好的学生选送到你的学校。

definition: to exhibit as broadcast/to show (on TV)
to select/to detail/to set apart/to appoint
to display for evaluation/to exhibit and compare
direct, winner-takes-all system of election in use for village committees/preselection for a competition
preliminary contest/initial heats of a competition
to assist/to help sb do sth/to cooperate in doing sth
